task.title: Issues Encountered and Resolutions During Build

events.content: ISSUE: Workspace detection found ~/.Trash instead of project directory: ISSUE: Workspace detection found ~/.Trash instead of project directory

raw.question: ISSUE: Workspace detection found ~/.Trash instead of project directory
raw.chosen: ISSUE: Workspace detection found ~/.Trash instead of project directory
raw.reasoning: Relay daemon's workspace detection algorithm found ~/.Trash as the git root because it was technically a git repository. Resolution: Initialized git in the target project directory before starting the daemon, ensuring correct workspace detection.

events.content: ISSUE: Agents built wrong app (relay-pty lifecycle) initially: ISSUE: Agents built wrong app (relay-pty lifecycle) initially

raw.question: ISSUE: Agents built wrong app (relay-pty lifecycle) initially
raw.chosen: ISSUE: Agents built wrong app (relay-pty lifecycle) initially
raw.reasoning: First wave agents misinterpreted the task and built a 'relay-pty lifecycle' visualization instead of 'swarm patterns'. This happened because the task description was ambiguous. Resolution: Spawned new specialized agents (SwarmDev, UIBuilder) with explicit task descriptions. Recommendation: Add formal task contracts/specs to relay protocol.

events.content: ISSUE: Node 18 incompatible with Vite 7 (SyntaxError with node:util): ISSUE: Node 18 incompatible with Vite 7 (SyntaxError with node:util)

raw.question: ISSUE: Node 18 incompatible with Vite 7 (SyntaxError with node:util)
raw.chosen: ISSUE: Node 18 incompatible with Vite 7 (SyntaxError with node:util)
raw.reasoning: Initial scaffolding used Vite 7 which requires Node 20+. Node 18 threw SyntaxError when importing from node:util. Resolution: Used older compatible package versions that support Node 18. Recommendation: Upgrade Node or pin Vite version in scaffold.

events.content: ISSUE: Source files lost during Vite dev server crash: ISSUE: Source files lost during Vite dev server crash

raw.question: ISSUE: Source files lost during Vite dev server crash
raw.chosen: ISSUE: Source files lost during Vite dev server crash
alternatives: Accept loss and rebuild from scratch
raw.reasoning: Vite's file watcher triggered an unexpected cleanup that deleted source files during a dev server crash. The swarm-viz source code was lost and had to be rebuilt. Resolution: Used relay agents to rebuild from memory/context. Recommendation: Add checkpoint/rollback mechanism to relay protocol for file recovery.

events.content: ISSUE: swarm-viz had no package.json after file loss: ISSUE: swarm-viz had no package.json after file loss

raw.question: ISSUE: swarm-viz had no package.json after file loss
raw.chosen: ISSUE: swarm-viz had no package.json after file loss
raw.reasoning: After rebuilding, discovered swarm-viz directory was missing package.json, preventing npm install and dev server. Files were in wrong location. Resolution: Copied rebuilt files to correct parent directory structure and ensured package.json was present.

events.content: ISSUE: Wrong dev server running (parent vs swarm-viz): ISSUE: Wrong dev server running (parent vs swarm-viz)

raw.question: ISSUE: Wrong dev server running (parent vs swarm-viz)
raw.chosen: ISSUE: Wrong dev server running (parent vs swarm-viz)
raw.reasoning: Multiple times the wrong Vite dev server was running - serving the parent directory instead of swarm-viz. This caused the relay-pty lifecycle app to appear instead of swarm patterns. Resolution: Killed wrong processes and explicitly ran dev server from correct directory with correct port.

events.content: ISSUE: AnimatedFlow expected MessageWrapper[] but received Message[]: ISSUE: AnimatedFlow expected MessageWrapper[] but received Message[]

raw.question: ISSUE: AnimatedFlow expected MessageWrapper[] but received Message[]
raw.chosen: ISSUE: AnimatedFlow expected MessageWrapper[] but received Message[]
raw.reasoning: AnimatedFlow component was written expecting MessageWrapper[] (with nested message property) but the parser returned Message[] directly. This caused 'undefined' errors when accessing m.message.from. Resolution: Updated component to accept Message[] directly, changed accessors from m.message.from to m.from.

events.content: ISSUE: No messages animating in AnimatedFlow: ISSUE: No messages animating in AnimatedFlow

raw.question: ISSUE: No messages animating in AnimatedFlow
raw.chosen: ISSUE: No messages animating in AnimatedFlow
raw.reasoning: AnimatedFlow page passed 'currentMessages' (an empty slice from pagination) instead of all messages. Since currentMessages was empty or small, no particles appeared. Resolution: Changed page to pass data.messages (all 1,709 messages) to AnimatedFlow component for proper animation.

events.content: ISSUE: Detached HEAD state preventing branch creation: ISSUE: Detached HEAD state preventing branch creation

raw.question: ISSUE: Detached HEAD state preventing branch creation
raw.chosen: ISSUE: Detached HEAD state preventing branch creation
raw.reasoning: Git was in detached HEAD state at commit a799c9a, and a 'main' branch already existed. Could not create new main branch. Resolution: Deleted existing main branch (git branch -D main), then created new main branch from current HEAD (git checkout -b main).

events.content: ISSUE: README stated '15 minutes' build time (inaccurate): ISSUE: README stated '15 minutes' build time (inaccurate)

raw.question: ISSUE: README stated '15 minutes' build time (inaccurate)
raw.chosen: ISSUE: README stated '15 minutes' build time (inaccurate)
raw.reasoning: Initial README claimed '~15 minutes' session duration, but message timestamps showed actual duration was 7.5 hours (01:10 to 08:45). Resolution: Corrected to accurate '~7.5 hours' based on JSONL message timestamps.

retrospective.summary: Documented 9 significant issues encountered during the 7.5-hour build: workspace detection, task misinterpretation, Node version incompatibility, file loss, missing package.json, wrong dev server, data format mismatch, empty animations, git state issues, and documentation inaccuracy. All resolved with specific fixes.
retrospective.approach: Each issue was addressed as encountered, with root cause analysis and targeted resolution. Several issues led to protocol improvement recommendations documented in relay-feedback/REPORT.md.
